talent.subject: Confirmation - Washington State Chinese Language and Talent Competition Registration
talent.message:
Dear {%contact%}:

This is to confirm your registration for the 2015 WA Chinese Language and Talent Competition scheduled on 3/22/2015 (Sunday) at Chief Sealth International High School. Please see below for a list of the categories you have signed up:

  • Type: {%type%}
  • Category: {%category%}
  • Division: {%division%}
  • Class: {%class%}
  • Registration ID: {%studentId%}
  • Contestants: {%contestants%}

If you notice any errors on the list, please contact us.

To ensure a smooth experience for everyone, please review the following important announcements. If you are a parent or teacher, please be sure your students or children know about these announcements as well.

  1. Please check in at the school entrance to receive a packet that contains your competition schedule, room assignment, name tag, and participation award (ribbon & pin). Please come early to avoid long waiting lines. Parking might be limited, please carpool as much as possible.
  2. Contestant must report to the assigned room 15 minutes before competition begins. If there is more than one category scheduled for the same time, please report to the assigned room based on the order listed in the sign in sheet you receive when you check in. For more information about the competition order, please refer to Q2 in the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) on the CE website or check with our information desk at the school entrance when you come in.
  3. The awards ceremony will be held on the same day as the competition, beginning at 2:00PM at Chief Sealth International High School’s auditorium. Unless noted otherwise, the top three performers in each category, division, and class will be awarded with trophies, certificates, ribbons (team competition only), as well as scholarships ($50 for individual, and $100 for the team competition).Please feel free to invite your family members and friends to join us for this recognition event.
  4. For those who are participating in the Drawing contest, please remember to bring your own drawing tools such as oil, acrylic, pastel, charcoal, water color, colored pencil, marker or ink. The event organizer will only provide drawing papers (including the rice paper for Chinese brush painting). Please be sure to pick up your drawing by the school entrance (where you check in) after the award ceremony.
  5. For your convenience, there will be a food stand on site offering lunch selections, snacks, and drinks at a reasonable price. There will also be a resting area for the contestants and parents to wait and relax. Please feel free to bring family and friends to come and join the audience . If there is anything else we can do to make your participation more comfortable, please don’t hesitate to let us know.

Thank you for your participation and we hope you will have a rewarding experience at the competition. If you have any questions, please contact us.

Sincerely,

Competition Administration Team

report.subject: Final Confirmation - 2015 Washington State Chinese Language and Talent Competition
report.message:
Dear Contestants, Parents, and Teachers:

To ensure a smooth experience for everyone, please review the following important announcements and reminders. If you are a parent or teacher, please be sure your students or children know about these announcements as well.
  • Attached please find the final confirmation for the competitions you sign up. If you see any discrepancies, please contact us at ce2015competition@culturalexploration.org as soon as possible. Also, as a reminder, please be sure to check-in at the school entrance at least 15 minutes before your first competition. School parking is limited, please car pool as much as possible. You may find additional parking by the football field across the street from school.
  • In order to finish all the competitions in one day, unavoidably some of the categories must overlap. However, that doesn’t mean the contestants are limited to compete. . If there is more than one category scheduled for the same time, please report to the assigned room based on the order listed in the sign in sheet you receive when you check in. For more information about the competition order, please refer to Q2 in the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) on the CE website at https://culturalexploration.org/documents/talent/2015_Frequently_Asked_Questions.pdf. The school map is also available at our information desk at the school entrance for directions when you come in.
  • Please be reminded that for the individual language related competitions, the judges have the right to promote contestants whose Chinese language skills are much higher than expected for Class C or Class B to again compete in Class A or Class B and the scores that they earned in Class C or Class B will be voided. Please check the promotion list posted at the administrative center 10 minutes after the competition.
  • Please note, as stated in the regulation, that any assistances or cues from the parents or teachers to the contestants while performing on the stage are strictly prohibited. The violation of this rule will result in a disqualification.
  • If you are taking photos at the event, we would appreciate it if you could share them with us (at the administrative center by the school commons) so we can use them for a slide presentation at the ceremony.
Thank you and we wish you a wonderful experience on Sunday, 3/22/2015.

Sincerely,

Competition Planning Committee
